alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 9:54PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne and southeastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 1030 PM MDT... At 953 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles north of Cheyenne Wells, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, dime to penny size hail, and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne and southeastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 430 and 439. Highway 385 between mile markers 159 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
